introduction: Two sisters who become nude art models are drawn into New York’s darker world of prostitution and degradation, where “If you didn’t go to the limit, you were considered a square!” Long considered lost, The Orgy at Lil’s Place is an important missing link in the history of sexploitation films. This high-grossing early “roughie” helped set the tone for violent cautionary tales about the 1960s sexual revolution taking place both on- and off-screen. This recently rediscovered 35mm print appears courtesy of the Kinsey Institute for Research in Sex, Gender and Reproduction. Filmed MOS style with a great jazzy soundtrack.
